Description: A pale blue glazed composition tile: with a convex face, but without a projection on the back. The edges are bevelled inwards towards the back of the tile to aid inlaying, and the tile is pierced horizontally for fixing on a wire. One end is marked with a series of incised lines. Good condition, glaze partially decayed to white.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Chamber M69 deposit
Curator's comments: For parallels, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl. VII, 101, 103; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Prehistoric Egypt : corpus of prehistoric pottery and palettes' (Warminster, 1974), pl. XLIX, 20-3; G. Dreyer, 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 32 (Wiesbaden, 1976), 86, VI (a) and pl.26a-b.
Bibliographic references: Friedman 1998 / Gifts of the Nile: Ancient Egyptian Faience (15)
